info.title: REST API for Oracle Fusion Cloud Enterprise Data Management
info.description: Describes how to use the Oracle Fusion Cloud Enterprise Data Management REST API
info.x-summary: Describes how to use the Oracle Fusion Cloud Enterprise Data Management REST API

get.summary: Gets a node in a viewpoint

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: filters node

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: populates additional data within the node

get.summary: Gets nodes in a viewpoint

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: filters nodes

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: populates additional data within each node

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limits the number of nodes returned in the response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: specifies the offset from which to start when returning nodes

parameters.name: fromId
parameters.description: specifies the id of a node. Only nodes that are after this node (respecting defined node order) will be returned. A '*'suffix after the node id means to also include the node itself. Also, "first" can be supplied, which will return nodes from the start. Cannot be combined with toId

parameters.name: toId
parameters.description: specifies the id of a node. Only nodes that are before this node (respecting defined node order) will be returned. A '*' suffix after the node id means to also include the node itself. Also, "last" can be supplied, which will return nodes starting from the end. Cannot be combined with fromId

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Specifies the order in which to return nodes

post.summary: Searches for nodes in the viewpoint using supplied criteria

parentNodeId.description: id of the parent node this action was performed under, if any

extendedProperties.description: customizable JSON content supplied by client

parentNodeId.description: id of the parent node this action was performed under, if any

extendedProperties.description: customizable JSON content supplied by client

parentNodeId.description: id of the parent node this action was performed under, if any

extendedProperties.description: customizable JSON content supplied by client

parentNodeId.description: id of parent node under which to insert. Omit to add the node without inserting. Set to all 0's to make a top node

afterSiblingId.description: id of the child under the the parent node after which this node should appear

nodeTypeUri.description: URI of nodeType for the node

relationshipNodeUri.description: URI of relationship node to remove

createdBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use createdByUser instead.

modifiedBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use modifiedByUser instead.

externalSystemTypeLabel.description: External System Type Label; used if externalSystemType is not specified

createdBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use createdByUser instead.

modifiedBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use modifiedByUser instead.

Dimension.description: Dimension model that would be returned as response

type.description: Type is set to "DEFAULT" for standard settings, "FCGL" for Financial Cloud Import/Export options.

processSegmentValuesAndHierarchies.description: Process Account Hierarchies??? (without publish) separately for each valueset.

publishHierarchiesToCube.description: Invoke Publish for all value sets at once.

allOf.description: Details the fields specific to a Financial Cloud connection

HierarchySet.description: Hierarchy Set model that would be returned as response

dataSourceName.description: The data source name of the request item.

sourceNodeName.description: The name of the source node.

location.description: This property is now deprecated. Use path instead.

NodeSet.description: Node Set model that would be returned as response

afterSiblingId.description: id of node under the same parent after which to insert this node

origin.description: Specifies the allowable origins for a request.

requestType.description: Specifies the allowable request types for a request.

status.description: Specifies the allowable statuses for a request.

stage.description: Specifies the allowable stages for a request.

createdBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use createdByUser instead.

modifiedBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use modifiedByUser instead.

submittedBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use submittedByUser instead.

assignedTo.description: This property is now deprecated. Use assignedToUser instead.

consolidationRequestStatus.description: Specifies the allowable statuses for a consolidation request.

viewStatus.description: Specifies the allowable statuses for a view.

valWarningCountOnClose.description: If the request is closed, the number of validation warnings that existed, and were allowed, at the time it was closed.

Request.description: A Request models changes to apply to a View

RequestItem.description: A Request Item is a collection of actions to apply to a particular node as part of aRequest

severity.description: The severity of the validation issue (ERROR or WARNING) for the stage at which the validation failed.

createdBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use createdByUser instead.

modifiedBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use modifiedByUser instead.

propertyValue.description: the new value for the property

propertyUri.description: the URI to the property to update on the node

parentNodeId.description: id of parent node under which to insert. Set to all 0's to make a top node

afterSiblingId.description: id of node under the same parent after which to insert this node

sourceParentNodeId.description: id of the parent to move from

targetParentNodeId.description: id of the parent to move to

afterSiblingId.description: id of the child under the given target node after which the node should appear

viewName.description: Name of the view for the query

viewpointName.description: Name of the viewpoint for the query. Either the viewpoint name or viewpoint label are required.

viewpointLabel.description: Label of the viewpoint for the query. Either the viewpoint name or viewpoint label are required.

queryName.description: Name of the query to be run. Either the query code or query name are required.

queryCode.description: Code of the query to be run. Either the query code or query name are required.

fileName.description: Name of the file containing the query results. This file is written to the staging area.

requestNumber.description: Request number to perform query in the context of a request

submitSeverity.description: Severity (WARNING or ERROR) of the constraint validation at the submit stage.

approveSeverity.description: Severity (WARNING or ERROR) of the constraint validation at the approve stage.

commitSeverity.description: Severity (WARNING or ERROR) of the constraint validation at the commit stage.

viewpointSeverity.description: Severity (WARNING or ERROR) of the constraint validation during viewpoint data export.

Constraint.description: Constraint model that is returned as response

connectionName.description: Name of the global connection to use for the extract. The connection must be allowed for the application of the viewpoint extract.

connectionOptions.description:
Options for the global connection used by the extract. 
"Object" Storage expects 'bucket' with an optional 'subfolder' field. 
"EPM" Cloud expects 'folder' field. 
"UCM" expects 'defaultDocumentAccount'.

type.description: Type is set to "EPM" for Oracle Cloud EPM connections, "EPM_OAUTH" for Oracle Cloud EPM OAUTH connections, "UCM" for Oracle Cloud ERP connections and "ORACLE_OBJECT_STORE" for Oracle Object Store connections.

Global Connection Details.description:
The details specific to this connection type. All connection types include a "type", the type of the connection.  See the "type" object for allowed values. 
EPM connections also include:
"url", the URL for the connection,
"identityDomain", the identity domain for the connection,
"username", the username for the connection,
"password", a placeholder value for the connection's password,
"folder", the default folder in the EPM inbox 

EPM OAuth connections also include:
"url", the URL for the connection,
"clientId", a placeholder value for the connection's client id,
"accessToken", a placeholder value for the connection's access token,
"refreshToken", a placeholder value for the connection's refresh token,
"authType", the authentication type for the connection,
"folder", the folder in the EPM inbox 

Oracle Object Store connections also include:
"url", the URL for the connection,
"username", the username for the connection,
"password", a placeholder value for the connection's password,
"defaultBucket", the default Object Storage bucket,
"defaultSubFolder", the default Object Storage subfolder 

UCM connections also include:
"url", the URL for the connection,
"username", the username for the connection,
"password", a placeholder value for the connection's password,
"identityDomain", the identity domain for the connection,
"defaultDocumentAccount", the default UCM document account

url.description: The url the of the connection.

identityDomain.description: The identity domain to authenticate the connection.

username.description: The user name to authenticate the connection.

password.description: The password to authenticate the connection.

allOf.description: Details the fields for an Oracle Cloud ERP connection

url.description: The url the of the connection.

username.description: The user name to authenticate the connection.

password.description: The password to authenticate the connection.

defaultBucket.description: The default bucket for the connection.

defaultSubfolder.description: The default subfolder for the connection.

allOf.description: Details the fields for an Oracle Object Store connection

url.description: The updated url the of the target of the connection.

identityDomain.description: The updated identity domain authenticate the connection.

username.description: The updated user name to authenticate the connection.

password.description: The updated password to authenticate the connection.

allOf.description: Details the fields for an Oracle Cloud EPM connection

createdBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use createdByUser instead.

modifiedBy.description: This property is now deprecated. Use modifiedByUser instead.

type.description: Type should be set to "EPM" for Oracle Cloud EPM connections, "EPM_OAUTH" for Oracle EPM_OAUTH connections, "UCM" for Oracle Cloud ERP connections and "ORACLE_OBJECT_STORE" for Oracle Object Store connections.

Global Connection Test Details.description:
The details specific to this connection type. All connection types include a "type", the type of the connection.  See the "type" object for allowed values.
EPM connections also include:
"url", the URL for the connection,
"identityDomain", the identity domain for the connection,
"username", the username for the connection,
"password", the password for the connection. Leave blank to use the already stored password. 

EPM OAuth connections also include:
"url", the URL for the connection,
"clientId", the client Id for the connection. Leave blank to use the already client Id.
"accessToken", the access token for the connection. Leave blank to use the already stored access token.
"refreshToken", the refresh token for the connection. Leave blank to use the already refresh token.
"authType", the authentication type for the connection. Use OAuth. 

Oracle Object Store connections also include:
"url", the URL for the connection,
"username", the username for the connection,
"password", the password for the connection. Leave blank to use the already stored password.
"defaultBucket", the updated default Object Storage bucket

UCM connections also include:
"url", the URL for the connection,
"username", the username for the connection,
"password", the password for the connection. Leave blank to use the already stored password.
"identityDomain", the identity domain for the connection

url.description: The updated url the of the target of the connection.

password.description: The updated password to authenticate the connection.

type.description: Type should be set to "EPM" for Oracle Cloud EPM connections, "EPM_OAUTH" Oracle Cloud EPM OAUTH connections, "UCM" for Oracle Cloud ERP connections and "ORACLE_OBJECT_STORE" for Oracle Object Store connections.

Update Global Connection Details.description:
The details specific to this connection type. All connection types include a "type", the type of the connection.  See the "type" object for allowed values.
EPM connections also include:
"url", the updated URL for the connection,
"identityDomain", the updated identity domain for the connection,
"username", the updated username for the connection,
"password", the updated password for the connection,
"folder", the updated default folder in the EPM inbox 

EPM OAuth connections also include:
"url", the updated URL for the connection,
"clientId", the updated client Id for the connection,
"accessToken", the updated access token for the connection,
"refreshToken", the updated refresh token for the connection,
"authType", the authentication type for the connection. Use OAuth.
"folder", the updated folder in the EPM inbox 

Oracle Object Store connections also include:
"url", the updated URL for the connection,
"username", the updated username for the connection,
"password", the updated password for the connection,
"defaultBucket", the updated default Object Storage bucket,
"defaultSubFolder", the updated Object Storage subfolder 

UCM connections also include:
"url", the updated URL for the connection,
"username", the updated username for the connection,
"password", the updated password for the connection,
"identityDomain", the updated identity domain for the connection,
"defaultDocumentAccount", the updated default UCM document account

applications.description: List of application ids to filter the transaction history records

includeRelatedRequests.description: includeRelatedRequests checkbox to include requests in same lineage

limit.description: Limit for number of transaction history records to export

exportOptions.description: Settings that control what is included in the exported content.

properties.description: List of property ids to filter the transaction history records

origins.description: List of origins to filter the transaction history records

limit.description: The maximum number of nodes to return in the search results

matchAllPredicates.description: If true, a node only matches if it matches all of the specified predicates

matchEachNodeInstance.description: If true, return every instance of a given node as a match

enabled.description: Specfies whether the policy should be enabled or disabled

applicationUri.description: the URI of the application the given property is being overridden on w/ the given expression, or null

nodeTypeUri.description: the URI of the nodeType the given property is being overridden on w/ the given expression, or null

nodeUri.description: the URI of a node or relationship to evaluate this expression against

application.description: application Id to match in either source or target

view.description: view Id to match in either source or target

viewpoint.description: viewpoint Id to match in either source or target

assignee.description: user or group Id matching as default or alternate assignee

applications.description: List of application ids to filter the permissions and policies report

dimensions.description: List of dimension ids to filter the permissions and policies report

nodeTypes.description: List of nodeType ids to filter the permissions and policies report

hierarchySets.description: List of hierarchySet ids to filter the permissions and policies report

users.description: List of user ids to filter the permissions and policies report

permissions.description: List of permission enums to filter the permissions and policies report

limit.description: Limit for number of permissions and policies report records to export

applications.description: List of application ids to filter the permissions and policies report

dimensions.description: List of dimension ids to filter the permissions and policies report

nodeTypes.description: List of nodeType ids to filter the permissions and policies report

hierarchySets.description: List of hierarchySet ids to filter the permissions and policies report

groups.description: List of user group ids to filter the permissions and policies report

permissions.description: List of permission enums to filter the permissions and policies report

limit.description: Limit for number of permissions and policies report records to export

fileName.description: Name of the file.

logoImageName.description: Name of the logo image file in the staging area. Valid file types are JPG, PNG and GIF. The image file must be first uploaded to the staging area.

backgroundImageName.description: Name of the background image file. It can only be used with Custom Dark and Custom Light themes. Allowed file types are JPG, PNG and GIF. The image file must be first uploaded to the staging area.

substituteRecipientName.description: User name of the substitute recipient.

emailSubjectPrefix.description: Configure prefix to apply at the subject of the email.

oglApplicationId.description: Application Id of Oracle Guided Learning.

oglServerURL.description: Server Url for Oracle Guided Learning.

attachSubscriptionRequestFile.description: Include the request file as attachment for subscription notification email.

attachRequestFile.description: Include the request file as attachment for approver/committer notification email.

preventSubmittedRequestDeletion.description: Prevent a submitted request from being deleted.

requestActionPurgePeriod.description: Defines the number of months before actions are purged from completed requests. Allowed value ranges between 6 and 18.

fiscalYearEndMonth.description: Specify the last month of the fiscal year.

preventRequestActions.description: Actions to prevent. Allowed values are REJECT, PUSHBACK, RECALL.

preventReqActionByOrigin.description: Prevent for these request types. Allowed values are INTERACTIVE, SUBSCRIPTION, CONSOLIDATION, IMPORT, LOAD.

fileName.description: Name of the template file in the staging area to import.

importOptions.description: Options to use when importing the template file.

policyGroups.description: Determines how differences in policy groups are applied to target objects during template import.  During Merge, new policy groups are added from the template and existing policy groups are retained in the target environment.  During Replace, new policy groups are added and existing policy groups in the target environment are replaced with those from the source template.  Default behavior is to merge.

permissions.description: Determines how differences in permissions are applied to target objects during template import.  During Merge, new permissions are added from the template and existing permissions are retained in the target environment.  During Replace, new permissions are added and existing permissions in the target environment are replaced with those from the source template.  Default behavior is to merge.

propertyNodeTypeOverrides.description: Determines how differences in node type level overrides are applied to target properties during template import. During Merge, new property node type overrides are added from the template and existing property node type overrides are updated or retained in the target environment. During Replace, new property node type overrides are added and existing property node type overrides in the target environment are replaced with those from the source template. Default behavior is to merge.

filterArchivedObjects.description: Determines whether to exclude archived objects during template import if the objects do not already exist. Default behavior is to include archived objects.

ImportTemplateOptionsJson.description: Options to use when importing the template file.

applications.description: Names of the applications for which to export a template.

dimensions.description: Names of the applications and dimensions for which to export a template. Each application and dimension combination must be separated by the | delimiter.  Example:  applicationName|dimensionName

fileName.description: Name of the template file exported to the staging area. Example: application.json

applicationName.description: Application name for which transaction history is to be exported.

dimensionName.description: Dimension name for which transaction history is to be exported.

nodeTypeName.description: Node type name for which transaction history is to be exported.

hierarchySetName.description: Hierarchy set name for which transaction history is to be exported.

viewName.description: View name for which transaction history is to be exported.

viewpointName.description: Viewpoint name for which transaction history is to be exported.

users.description: List of usernames separated by comma for which transaction history is to be exported.

nodeName.description: Node name for which transaction history is to be exported.

actions.description: List of action names separated by comma for which transaction history is to be exported.

requestNumber.description: Request Number for which transaction history is to be exported.

fromDate.description: Epoch date in seconds after which transaction history is to be exported. Either fromDate or lastDays should be passed. The period cannot exceed 90 days.

toDate.description: Epoch date in seconds before which transaction history is to be exported. toDate has to be after the fromDate. The period cannot exceed 90 days.

lastDays.description: Number of days for which transaction history is to be exported. Maximum value of 90. Either fromDate or lastDays should be passed.

fileName.description: The target file name with .xlsx extension to export the transaction history to.

downloadOption.description: Specifies the content to be included in the exported file. Default value is TRANSACTION_HIST_ONLY.

includeRelatedRequests.description: Specifies whether requests in the same lineage as that of the request number should be included in the export. Should be used only when request number is provided. Default value is false.

connectionDetails.description: A string containing a json representation of the connection details

primary.description: A flag indicating if this is the primary connection for this application

connectionInfo.description: The url and authentication information for the connection

url.description: The target url of the connection

username.description: The user name to authenticate the connection

password.description: A placeholder value for the connection's password

clientId.description: A placeholder value for the connection's clientId

accessToken.description: A placeholder value for the connection's access token

refreshToken.description: A placeholder value for the connection's refresh token

domain.description: The identity domain for the connection

primary.description: Boolean flag to specify if this connection is the primary connection for the application

url.description: The updated target url of the connection.

domain.description: The updated identity domain for non-OAuth connection.

username.description: The updated username for the connection.  Required for the Basic authentication type.

password.description: The updated password for the connection.  Required for the Basic authentication type.

clientId.description: The updated client ID for the connection.  Required for the OAuth authentication type.

refreshToken.description: The updated refresh token for the connection.  Required for the OAuth authentication type.

accessToken.description: The updated access token for the connection.  Required for the OAuth authentication type

url.description: The target url of the connection

domain.description: The identity domain for the non-OAuth connection

username.description: The updated username for the connection.  Required for the Basic authentication type.

password.description: The updated password for the connection.  Used for the Basic authentication type.  Leave blank to use the already stored password.

clientId.description: The updated client ID for the connection.  Required for the OAuth authentication type.

refreshToken.description: The updated refresh token for the connection.  Required for the OAuth authentication type.

accessToken.description: The updated access token for the connection.  Required for the OAuth authentication type.

fileName.description: The target file name to extract the package to

extractToConnection.description: Flag indicating to output to the package connection.

applicationName.description: The name of the application the extract package belongs to.

extractPackageName.description: The name of the extract package.

fileName.description: The target file name to extract to. The file name must include the .zip extension

connectionName.description: The name of the connection to extract to. If not provided, file will be extracted to the staging area.

bindingSlotAnswers.description: slot answers to set on the binding

copyDataChain.description: set to true to copy the underlying viewpoint, node set, and hierarchy set

targetViewpointName.description: name to use on the newly created target viewpoint, if copyDataChain is enabled

targetNodeSetName.description: name to use on the newly created target target node set, if copyDataChain is enabled

targetHierarchySetName.description: name to use on the newly created target target hierarchy set, if copyDataChain is enabled

applicationName.description: The name of the application the dimension to export belongs to.

dimensionName.description: The name of the dimension to export.

connectionName.description: The name of the connection to export to, if exporting to a connection instead of to a direct file download.

since.description: The timestamp starting from which to export changes within the selected dimension bindings. Required if SinceLastExportOfType is not provided.

sinceLastExportOfType.description: The type of export to find the most recent occurrence of, and export changes starting from that time. Required if Since is not provided.

bindingNames.description: A list of names of bindings in this dimension to export from.

nodeChangeTypes.description: A list of types of node changes to export.

fileName.description: The name to use for the exported file. A Universal application will produce a file in CSV format, while other application types produce a file in zip format.
The target file name to export the dimension to. File will be exported to the staging area or the specified connection.

applicationName.description: Name of Application for which Dimension to export

connection.description: Name of connection where the export file is written to. If not supplied, the export file is written to the staging area.

dimensionName.description: The name of the dimension to extract.

applicationName.description: The name of the application the dimension to extract belongs to.

connection.description: The name of the connection to extract to, if extracting to a connection instead of to a direct file download.

fileName.description: The target file name to extract the dimension to. If the Zip Extract option is disabled in the extract profile, use the text file name. If the Zip Extract option is enabled, use the zip file name.

fromTime.description:
Overrides the From Time for an Incremental extract. Not applicable to other extract types.
Timestamp can be provided in the following formats:
YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS (UTC)
YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS +hh:mm or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS -hh:mm (time zone offset)
YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS Region/City (time zone name)

toTime.description:
Overrides the To Time for an Incremental extract. Not applicable to other extract types.
Timestamp can be provided in the following formats:
YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS (UTC)
YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS +hh:mm or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS -hh:mm (time zone offset)
YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS Region/City (time zone name)

fileName.description: Name of the file to import. File should be in the staging area or the specified connection.

importOption.description: Option for Reset/Replace/Merge on Import. Default value is Replace.

applicationName.description: Name of Application for which Dimension to import.

connection.description: Name of connection where the import file is read from. If not supplied, the import file is read from the staging area.

fileName.description: The target file name to export the dimension mapping to. File will be exported to the staging area or the specified connection.

mappingLocation.description: Name of the mapping location to export

applicationName.description: Name of Application for which Dimension mapping to export

connection.description: Name of connection where the export file is written to. If not supplied, the export file is written to the staging area.

loadName.description: Name of the defined load profile for the dimension.

fileName.description: Name of the file to load. File must be in the staging area.
The target file name to export the dimension to.

connectionId.description: The id of the connection to export the dimension (for export to connection only).

fileName.description: The target file name to export the dimension mapping to

connectionId.description: The id of the connection to which to export the dimension mapping (for export to connection only)

fileUri.description: URI of the file to import

importOption.description: Option for Reset/Replace/Merge on Import. Default value is Replace.

resetDimension.description: Set to true to reset the dimension prior to import. If importOption is provided, then resetDimension is ignored. Default value is false.

fileName.description: the name of the file to import from at the given connection

connectionId.description: the id of the configured connection to import from

importOption.description: Option for Reset/Replace/Merge on Import. Default value is Replace.

resetDimension.description: Set to true to reset the dimension prior to import. If importOption is provided, then resetDimension is ignored. Default value is false.

expressionDocument.description: the json document representing the transformation expression

propertyUri.description: the URI of the property being transformed

nodeUri.description: the URIs of node or relationship to evaluate this transformation expression against

sourceNodeTypeUri.description: the URI of the source node type of the converter

RequestAttachment.description: A request attachment is a file uploaded and associated with a request

fileName.description: The name of the Request Excel File attachment to generate.

items.description: A list of items (rows) to be added to the excel file.

overwrite.description: If true, an existing Request attachment will be overwritten.

path.description: the path in the resource to apply the change to

value.description: the new value, if applicable, to change to

op.description: the operation to use to apply the change

Patch.description: A Json Patch-formatted change to be applied to a resource. See jsonpatch.com.

requestLineageNodes.description: The list of requests used in this lineage.

subscriptionInstances.description: The list of subscriptions used in this lineage.

attachmentUri.description: URI of the attachment file to import

comment.description: Optional comment while assigning a request

requestNumber.description: Request Number for the request that is used for assignment

userName.description: Name of the user who the request is being assigned to

transitionWithWarning.description: Indicates that the transition to the next stage can proceed even if there are custom validation failures, as long as all failures are WARNING severity.

RequestsActivity.description: A RequestsActivityResource models summary information about requests for a filter

title.description: The title for the request being created.

description.description: The description for the request being created.

notes.description: Notes for the request being created.

priority.description: Priority of the request being created.

origin.description: The Origin of a request, currently only Interactive is supported.

viewUri.description: The View Uri that we will be creating a request for.

timeLabelName.description: Name of the future time label for the request being created.

viewName.description: Name of the view for the compare profile

compareProfileName.description: Name of the compare profile to be run

fileName.description: Name of the file containing the compare results. This file is written to the staging area.

requestNumber.description: Optional Request Number used to run the Compare Profile in the context of a request.

copyNodes.description: set to true to copy underlying node types and nodes

copyRelationships.description: set to true to copy underlying relationships

nodeRelationshipId.description: The id of the node for which descendants are to be downloaded

requestId.description: The id of the request context in which viewpoint is to be downloaded

downloadType.description: Settings that control what is included in the downloaded content.

SubscriptionLineageLink.description: Subscription details for viewpoint lineage diagram

viewLineageNodes.description: The list of views used in this lineage.

subscriptionLineageLinks.description: The list of subscriptions used in this lineage.

viewName.description: Name of the view for which viewpoint to load.

viewpointName.description: Name of the viewpoint to load.

fileName.description: Name of the file to load. File must be in the staging area.

purpose.description: The purpose or reason for running the load.

fileName.description: Name of the file to process.

fileUri.description: URI of the file to load.

purpose.description: The purpose or reason for running the viewpoint load.

viewName.description: Name of the view for the viewpoint to be validated.

viewpointName.description: Name of the viewpoint to be validated.

requestNumber.description: Request number to perform validation in the context of a request.

fileName.description: Name of the file containing the validation results. This file is written to the staging area.
